intro: Gurania tricuspidata var. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gurania, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
